title: Gate admin panel behind quick link + password and ensure Quote Requests are visible in admin UI

requirements.text: Hide the admin panel UI by default and only reveal it after the user clicks an "Admin" quick link and successfully enters the password "PonytaPower17!".

quotes: Do not have the admin panel show until you click the admin quick link and put in the password PonytaPower17!

acceptanceCriteria: On initial page load, the admin panel content (AdminOrderManagementSection) is not rendered anywhere on the page.
Clicking the Admin quick link opens the admin password prompt modal.
Entering the exact password "PonytaPower17!" unlocks the admin panel and scrolls to the admin section.
Entering an incorrect password does not unlock the admin panel and shows an error message.
Refreshing the page does not automatically keep the admin panel unlocked (password must be entered again).

requirements.text: Add an "Admin" quick link in the site footer Quick Links list that triggers the same admin unlock flow as the header Admin button (open password prompt when locked; scroll to admin section when unlocked).
acceptanceCriteria: The footer "Quick Links" section contains an "Admin" button/link.
When admin is locked, clicking the footer "Admin" quick link opens the password prompt modal.
When admin is already unlocked, clicking the footer "Admin" quick link scrolls smoothly to the admin section.

requirements.text: Within the unlocked admin panel, ensure quote requests submitted via the public contact/quote form are visible in an admin "Quote Forms" / "Quotes" view.

quotes: In this admin panel, let the quote request be seen

acceptanceCriteria: The admin panel includes a visible tab/section for quote requests (e.g., "Quote Forms" / "Quotes").
The quote requests view lists submitted tickets (name, email, message, category, status).
If there are no submitted tickets, the view shows an English empty state message.
The backend endpoint used to list tickets is admin-protected (rejects non-admin callers).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components).
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add migration.mo only if persistent state schema changes require it.
nonGoals: Implementing secure server-side authentication based on the provided password (the password gate is UI-only).
Adding third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Adding real-time updates or push notifications for quote requests.
